# WHAT

> ### A wiki (/ˈwɪki/ WIK-ee) 

> is a hypertext publication collaboratively edited and managed by its own audience directly using a web browser. A typical wiki contains multiple pages for the subjects or scope of the project and could be either open to the public or limited to use within an organization for maintaining its internal knowledge base.

[source](https://www.wikiwand.com/en/Wiki)

# WHAT

> ### A wiki (/ˈwɪki/ WIK-ee) 

> is a hypertext publication **collaboratively** edited and managed by its own audience directly using a web browser. A typical wiki contains multiple pages for the subjects or scope of the project and could be either open to the public or limited to use within an organization for maintaining its **internal knowledge base**.

[source](https://www.wikiwand.com/en/Wiki)

---

# WHAT

.pull-left[
## Intent

- To have collect documentation about activities at LCBC

- Make it easier for anyone how needs information about how we organise ourselves/data/analyses to find what they need

- Document for posterity and reproducibility

- Make it less reliant on a single person giving the **exact** same information to all without forgetting important details

]

--

.pull-right[
## Types
- **projects**
  - participant explucion/inclusion
  - protocols
  - ID naming schemas
  - general purpose of project
- **analysis pipelines**
  - MRI pipelines details
  - PET pipeline details
- **User "how to's"**
  - How to connect to LH/TSD
  - How to work on TSD
  - How to secure your computer
  
etc
]
